definitions.definition: Anything broad and flexible that hangs loose , or that is attached by one side or end and is easily moved .
examples: The envelope flap seemed curiously wrinkled.

definitions.definition: A hinged surface on the trailing edge of the wings of an aeroplane , used to increase lift and drag .
A side fin of a ray .
The motion of anything broad and loose, or a sound or stroke made with it.
A controversy , scandal , stir , or upset .
examples: The comment caused quite a flap in the newspapers.

definitions.definition: A consonant sound made by a single muscle contraction , such as the sound /ɾ/ in the standard American English pronunciation of body .
A piece of tissue incompletely detached from the body, as an intermediate stage of plastic surgery.

definitions.label_groups: slang , vulgar , chiefly in the plural

definitions.definition: A blow or slap (especially to the face).
A connected component of the induced subgraph formed by deleting a set of vertices.

main_definition: Anything broad and flexible that hangs loose , or that is attached by one side or end and is easily moved .
secondary_definitions: ( aviation ) A hinged surface on the trailing edge of the wings of an aeroplane , used to increase lift and drag .
A side fin of a ray .
The motion of anything broad and loose, or a sound or stroke made with it.
A controversy , scandal , stir , or upset .
( phonetics ) A consonant sound made by a single muscle contraction , such as the sound /ɾ/ in the standard American English pronunciation of body .
( surgery ) A piece of tissue incompletely detached from the body, as an intermediate stage of plastic surgery.
( slang , vulgar , chiefly in the plural ) The labia , the vulva .
( obsolete ) A blow or slap (especially to the face).
( graph theory ) A connected component of the induced subgraph formed by deleting a set of vertices.
